summary: An email from July 17, 2008, discussing Jeffrey Epstein's legal troubles, specifically four pending federal lawsuits filed by attorney Jeff Herman. The email notes that Judge Marra has issued orders to show cause why default judgments shouldn't be entered against Epstein, who allegedly tried to avoid service, potentially exposing him to $200 million in damages.

keyFacts: Four federal lawsuits were pending against Jeffrey Epstein, all filed by attorney Jeff Herman.
Judge Marra issued orders to show cause why default judgments shouldn't be entered against Epstein in all four suits.
Epstein allegedly tried to avoid service and ignored deadlines, thinking mailed complaints constituted ineffective service.
Jeff Herman asked for $50 million in damages in each lawsuit, potentially totaling $200 million.
The email suggests Epstein's legal strategy may have been flawed, with the sender commenting 'so much money, so little skill.'
